Package se.bricole.xss.server

Interface Summary
AuthHandler A regular AuthHandler (also called "Authenticator" elsewhere in the documentation).
AuthHandlerPassive This passive AuthHandler also specifies a method of retreiving the password for a specific user, letting the server handle the authentication process (thus allowing use of MD5 authentication implemented in XSS).
Module An XML module does not usually need to implement this interface, since it is inherited by the XMLSessionTagHandler and XMLTagHandler interfaces.
ModuleRegistrar A Registrar module is a module that needs access to the Configuration object outside client access.
SessionEventListener The ClientEventListener interface is used for classes that wants to be informed of added and removed clients in a ClientProxy.
XMLModule  
XMLSessionTagHandler This interface should be implemented by all Stateful XML modules (a.k.a.
XMLTagHandler This interface should be implemented by stateless modules.
 

Class Summary
ClientProxy The ClientProxy object acts as the gateway between clients.
ClientSession Each ClientConnection is associated with exactly one client, and is therefore the primary interface for all client I/O and communication.
Configuration Handles loading of configuration and modules.
ECMAScriptModule  
IOProxy Creation date: (2001-06-10 07:18:40)
Server This is the class containing the "main" method, and is responsible for accepting and allocating incoming connections as well as garbage-collecting old ClientProxies and idle clients.
XMLUtil This class keeps static utility method to make it easier to create and handle XML objects.
 

Exception Summary
ModuleException An exception that can be thrown from a module or by the servers' module loader.
NoProxyAvailableException Creation date: (2001-06-11 19:29:33)
ParserException A ParserException is thrown whenever the XML parser failed to generate a valid document from supplied XML data.
